eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Bouh, D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension provides: 
- Conditions to check if a global/scene/object variable exists.
- Actions to copy object variables, global and scene variables.
- Actions to delete an existing global/scene variable from memory.
- Actions to create a global/scene variable using a text expression, rather than a variable name input.
- Expressions to get the value or text from a global/scene variable using a text expression, rather than a variable name.

Text expressions allows to enter the name of the variable with an expression like `"MyVar"+ ToString(Variable(Health))`
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ExtendedVariables
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add conditions, actions and expressions to check for the existence of a variable, copy variables, delete existing ones from memory, and create dynamic variables.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a global variable exists.
eventsFunctions.name: C_global_variable_exist

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the global variable exists.
eventsFunctions.name: GlobalVariableExist

events.inlineCode:
const globalVariables = runtimeScene.getGame().getVariables();
eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = globalVariables.has(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("GlobalVariableName"));

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a scene variable exists.
eventsFunctions.name: C_scene_variable_exist

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the scene variable exists.
eventsFunctions.name: SceneVariableExist

events.inlineCode:
const sceneVariables = runtimeScene.getVariables();
eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = sceneVariables.has(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("SceneVariableName"));

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object variable exists.
eventsFunctions.name: C_object_variable_exist

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object variable exists.
eventsFunctions.name: ObjectVariableExist

parameters.description: Name of the global variable to delete
parameters.name: GlobalVariableName

eventsFunctions.sentence: Delete the global variable _PARAM1_ from memory

events.inlineCode: runtimeScene.getGame().getVariables().remove(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("GlobalVariableName"));

parameters.description: Name of the global variable to delete
parameters.name: GlobalVariableName

eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the text of scene variable _PARAM1_ to _PARAM2_

events.inlineCode:

variable.setString(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("SceneVariableValue"));

eventsFunctions.description: Modify the text of a global variable.
eventsFunctions.name: ModifyGlobalVariableString
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the text of global variable _PARAM1_ to _PARAM2_

events.inlineCode:

variable.setString(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("GlobalVariableValue"));

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Select one or more methods of shaking:
- Position: Shake the X and/or Y position of the object 
- Angle: Shake the angle (rotation) of the object 
- Scale: Shake the scale of the object (must be a sprite)

Control how the object shakes:
- Amplitude: How far the object moves during each shake
- Duration: Amount of time to shake the object
- Time between shakes: Amount of time between each movement of the object
- Keep shaking until stopped (boolean)

Tips:
- For a single-shake effect, set the "Time between shakes" to be equal to "Duration"  (great for a hit or impact)
- To make the single-shake move in the opposite direction, use negative numbers 
- To repeat a single-shake effect in a loop, add a condition "Object is not shaking" 
- Use a long "Time between shakes" to simulate a slow moving object (like a ship rocking back and forth)
- Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters. 
- Use "Shake until stopped" to simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShakeObject
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).

Detect initial shake
Initiate the onScenePostEvents function

Run once before every shake movement

Reset drift detection variables
Calculate Position Shake
PositionDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude * [-1 or 1]
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate Rotation (angle) shake
Every "even" shake, rotate clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Every "odd" shake, rotate counter-clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.comment: Keep object shaking forever (if desired)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables
Calculate Position Shake
PositionDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude * [-1 or 1]
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate Rotation (angle) shake
Every "even" shake, rotate clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Every "odd" shake, rotate counter-clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Calculate Scale shake
Calculate object scale displacement, with linear decay over time
ScaleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude *  1/100
Every even shake, increase scale
Every "odd" shake, decrease scale
ScaleDisplacement = -1 * (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude *  1/100

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Manage health (life) and shield points of an object. Health can be assigned to players, enemies, NPCs, or even inanimate objects such as breaking doors and mining rocks.

How to use:

- Set desired values in "Health" and "Shield" behavior properties
- To apply damage use Damage an object or Damage an object protected by a shield
- To heal health, use Heal object action 
- To activate the shield, use Activate Shield action
- Health and shield regeneration will happen automatically based on properties
 
Tips:

- While damage cooldown is active, no damage will be applied to health or shield
- Try using the Blink extension while damage cooldown is active
- Use the Is just damaged condition to trigger audio and visual effects

Health properties:

- Health (life points) Used for starting health
- Maximum health (0 for no maximum)
- Damage cooldown (seconds) Use "0" for no cooldown
- Rate of health regeneration (points per second) Will not exceed max health, even with overhealing enabled
- Delay (seconds) before health regeneration starts after being hit
- Allow heal to increase health above max health (will not exceed max health)

Shield properties:

- Max shield points (Shield will start with this many points when activated)
- Duration of shield (seconds) Use "0" to disable shield timer
- Rate of shield regeneration (points per second)
- Shield will block all excess damage when shield is destroyed
- Delay (seconds) before shield regeneration starts after being hit
- Regenerate shield when it has zero points

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/), D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Draws a draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value.
The value range, tick spacing, and the appearance of the slider can be defined with properties.

How to use:
- Add this behavior a **Shape Painter** object
- Place an instance of that shape painter on the screen where you want the slider to appear
- Use the "Value" expression to find the Value based on the position of the slider

Tips:
- You can disable the slider to prevent a user from interacting with it
- You can set the Value of the slider and the slider will move to the correct position

Further details can be found in [this tutorial video](https://youtu.be/iiTUwdAT_hs).

Breaking changes (1.0.0)
- Track thickness and length properties replaced track width and height. These 2 properties must be set again if they were different from the default size.
- Hidden sliders can be dragged. The "enable" action must be used to disable them.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DraggableSliderControl
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Let users select a numerical value by dragging a slider.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: DraggableSliderControl

events.comment: Make sure object doesn't get re-drawn every frame
Use correct min value (instead of always starting at 0)
Set track height function (which enforces valid thumb sizes)
Start halo at same size as thumb
Track where the mouse is (in relation to object)
Move slider when being dragged
End sliding and update variables
Update "Value" based on the location of the thumb
Grow halo even more when pressed
Detect hover/touch/click (but only if the layer and object is visible, and the object is not already being dragged)
Detect mouse clicks near track, start dragging
Reset hover detection
Grow halo when hovered
Shrink halo to zero when not hovered
Redraw slider only when halo is not at final size
Set inactive track parameters (by default, use thumb color)
Draw inactive track
Draw half circle at end of track (inactive side)
Set active track parameters (by default, use thumb color)
Draw active track (2 pixels bigger than property)
Draw half circle at end of track (active side)
Prepare halo
Draw halo (it will grow or shrink as needed)
Use a more opaque halo while being dragged (it will grow or shrink as needed)
Prepare thumb settings
Draw Circle thumb
Draw Rectangle thumb
